intro: Schradera marahuacensis, commonly known as the Marahuaca schradera, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom during the wet season. Its leaves are palmately lobed and often have a waxy texture. Schradera marahuacensis plays a role in the ecological balance of its habitat by providing nectar for pollinators.
